website_summaries.verdict: These bags can be attached to the canopy legs themselves, rather than propped against them. They ship empty, and you fill them yourself.
pros: Set of 4 weight bags for canopies with leg size from 15 mm to 50 mm
Bags hold up to 25 pounds of sand, rock, or dirt
Waterproof 1680D polyester fabric coating with PVC, 300% stronger then most other weight bags
cons: If you need to use on concrete, consider placing a barrier between ground and bags to prevent holes from developing

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at the beach
customer_reviews.text: Used the sand bags at the beach to hold my 12x12 tent. Did a great job. I also used some 12 inch steaks but I feel like the bags would have done it by themselves. Set the tent up at 8am every morning when it was fairly calm and left it up all day for 5 days. Had a few folks ask where I got them and I pointed them here. Bags were very sturdy and had a top and bottom strap and a loop you could have put around the leg. I didn't empty the bags as I plan on using them to hold the tent if ever I need to put it up on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: HonestReviews

customer_reviews.title: ABCCANOPY Industrial Grade Weights Bag Leg Weights for Pop up Canopy Tent 4pcs-Pack
customer_reviews.text: Opted for the weight bags because the canopy was used on a deck and did not want to drill holes in the deck to bolt down canopy. The weights work great. They are a little big so you have to watch out so not to trip when walking around the supports. Plenty heavy enough to keep the canopy in place. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jim-on-the-ledge

customer_reviews.title: Great weights for the beach
customer_reviews.text: These are great. We bought a 10x10 canopy for the beach. I ordered these weights to use at the beach. The kids filled them up with sand. We used them at the beach in Michigan on a beach hazard day (windy) and my canopy didn't budge. Easy to fill and easy to empty, didn't take up much space once they were emptied.
customer_reviews.author: S. Friedman

customer_reviews.title: durable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought three packages of these to really anchor down my gazebo. It sits on a concrete slab so anchoring it to the ground was going to be very difficult. These bags are very durable, easy to fill and not too heavy to lift once full. They have velcro straps to go around the legs of the gazebo/tent - I would have liked the straps to be slightly longer to fit the thicker poles but it still worked. We had a pretty big wind storm just last week and the gazebo did not move. They are a basic enough design that they do not take away from the aesthetics of the structure either. Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these just in case I needed them for my canopy tent. I set up for the first time at a vendor event, and the wind was fierce! I decided to put the weights on. I filled the weights with 3 bottles of water in each side (6 bottles total per bag) and it worked great!! In a pinch, I grabbed a bottle of water to drink. For storage they lay flat. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia J

customer_reviews.title: Must have for beach!
customer_reviews.text: These are a wonderful investment! We use them at the beach and it keeps the canopy from blowing over, even without being staked down. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ambelina16

customer_reviews.title: They're just empty heavy duty fabric bags.
customer_reviews.text: Buy gallon size baggies and a roll of velco instead instead of these. They come flat and empty. You still have to add sand or gravel to these once you get them.
customer_reviews.author: stl2fun

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint with these is I wish the top had some sort of zip sealer so you could just put sand in there permanently, otherwise with the recommendation of filling a couple of 1 or 2 L bottles up with sand and using them for a clean way to hold everything down works perfectly would highly recommend it, worked well at the beach just using sand that is sitting around to weigh it down
customer_reviews.author: Ruff

customer_reviews.title: screwed up order...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the weights, I got a canopy thing. won't waste time sending it back for correction, also won't buy from them anymore. way to go. that's how you get/keep returning customers, by screwing up. good job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Both Pool Umbrellas In Place- FINALLY!!
customer_reviews.text: I had hopes that my umbrellas would finally quit being blown into the pool or down the yard. We go through them. Not once has our umbrellas been blown over and that is the first time ever! Super pleased and very happy that this inexpensive solution worked for us!
customer_reviews.author: S. Carawan

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality
customer_reviews.text: I love these! When I initially saw these, I got them to anchor my large cantilever umbrella in my yard. Once they arrived and I saw how well made they were I realized I need to order more to take to the beach with me. For years we had been hanging gallon bottles of water on our canopy when breezy outside. They are a pain to transport though. These bags will be easy to fill with sand upon arrival. The Velcro closure goes all the way across the opening making for a very secure closing. The straps to secure the bags are also very large and attached very well. Very superior quality!
customer_reviews.author: Kcuret

customer_reviews.title: Holds lots of sand, attached easily
customer_reviews.text: Good weights. I put almost two bags of home Depot sand in them. They straddle an awning well. They Have Velcro to secure them. I also use them to hold down a speaker stand supporting a small ham radio. I've only used them a few times, but they seem well constructed. They don't come with a carry bag. I couldn't carry all of them if they were in a bag. I move them with a roller cart when going to an event.
customer_reviews.author: Morris E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use (used only on saturday mornings) two bags have ripped on the seams
customer_reviews.author: eatcj05

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: First time use seams came apart on 2 of them no too closure not advantageous for the usage at events
customer_reviews.author: suzanne pinho

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for holding down my booth canopy
customer_reviews.text: These bags solve the problem of needing a reliable way to hold down a booth canopy at outdoor fairs. Easy to carry, simple to set up in moments. I love the Velcro straps for the ease and simplicity. Rain doesn’t bother them. I filled them with sand the first time I used them and never had to refill them since.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Willow

customer_reviews.title: Empty bags
customer_reviews.text: This is an empty bad, you have to buy gravel or sand to fill them up and a container (like ziplock bags. Misleading description not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: marcella

customer_reviews.title: If you're serious about these weighing a tent down and lasting a while, DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible. Straps don't go around the whole bag, Flimsy construction, too small to fill to be 25lbs, and velcro is useless. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the utmost cheapest piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This is the utmost cheapest piece of junk I have ever encountered!Do not buy very very cheap broke on setup. Trying to return and having problems with company they do not want to take it back.
customer_reviews.author: John Sandell

customer_reviews.title: They worked once
customer_reviews.text: We used these at the beach and they worked great until we picked them up to leave for the day and the Velcro straps ripped right off two of the bags. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Hchashm1023

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my couch in place
customer_reviews.text: A couple of times a year my deck gets assaulted with days of very high-speed wind. Last year this resulted in everything on the deck being blown into a corner on one end. This got me looking for options to add some additional security to some of the larger pieces to keep them in place. I purchased these weight bags and filled them pea gravel to add weight to an L-shaped couch, and my grill. I did use an extra plastic bag to secure the pea gravel inside the weight bag to help keep the contents from spilling out. All of the bags survived a full year outside with no sign of wear or issues with the contents spilling out.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: Wind proof weights for sure.
customer_reviews.text: We have had some very straight line winds since I put these weights on our canopy. It was amazing how much sand they held and so far the construction of them have been good. They have been sitting outside in heat with sun bearing down on them, wind and rain and they haven't lost any of the color or material degrading. The velcro has held on the poles really well.
customer_reviews.author: dakellogg

customer_reviews.title: not match my canopy
customer_reviews.text: my canopy has big leg and the velcro of this bag is not long enough for the leg after filled with sand. No use, send them back.
customer_reviews.author: johnny c.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have a seal on it to keep the sand in
customer_reviews.author: Rashida

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of my money, they're really to big and bunkey take up to much room.
customer_reviews.author: Claudine Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Easy fillable weight bags for canopy legs
customer_reviews.text: Collapsible easily filled (take your beach shovel) weights with secure Velcro fasteners. Keeps our small 8x8 canopy in place in a small-medium breeze. Kids enjoy helping to shovel, Dad can make sure they're secure.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Krayesky

customer_reviews.title: WOULD NOT recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOULD NOT recommend!!!NO WIND is needed, mine broke by the wind at the end of night.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Vercellin

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - velcro enclosure separated from stitching immediately
customer_reviews.text: This is ridiculous. I just received it, removed it from the packaging, and tried to open the velcro enclosure but the first bag I tried the velcro separated from the stitching. Extremely poor quality. I've never had an issue with a product like this.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: One of the four weight bags was not sewn shut on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: MarthaG

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on the beach
customer_reviews.text: The four sand bags worked really well. Good construction. Seemed to hold 40 pounds of sand per paired chambers. We used them to lock down a 10x10 sun shelter on a beach with 10-12 MPH breezes. Lots of sand there so filling them was easy. Zippers kept the sand in place. We wrapped the weights around the legs of the shelter using the attached straps and then ran a cord from the top of the sun shelter framing to the D rings of the sand bags. The shelter was solid!! The bags easily emptied. They were bulky, lightweight, to carry to the beach and did not come with a carry case but were otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: Abc Xyz

customer_reviews.title: Lemon?!
customer_reviews.text: One of the bags didn't have the Velcro tabs to secure it. Tried returning it but was over 30 days so option was removed, lame!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Borman

customer_reviews.title: leaking
customer_reviews.text: the bag is very small, I put gravel into it and weight only 9 LBS. not weight enough. There is no eyelet on the bottom so you can not stake down.
customer_reviews.author: John Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Canopy Weights
customer_reviews.text: For anyone wondering, this is for the bags only. You will need to purchase the sand separately. I was able to fill all four bags with 60 pound of all purpose sand, although two of the four bags are a little lighter. I believe each bag can hold about 20 pounds. Both straps does not go around my grill canopy but it's holding it in place from some pretty strong wind. I'll probably buy some 34" zip ties to tighten it up since I will be leaving these here permanently. I'll see how well it stands up to the Florida weather and will update the review if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: QuyDaddi

customer_reviews.title: Probably best to use on grass and dirt
customer_reviews.text: Don't place bags on concrete. Holes worked their way into the bags first usage. Probably best to use on grass and dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canopy Safety
customer_reviews.text: These weights are just awesome! I've used these weights for canopies when camping, and they are absolutely worth the "bother" of hauling sand-filled weights to hold your canopy down. Much safer than just standing up the canopy and hoping for no wind!
customer_reviews.author: HannahB

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for 20lbs of sand!
customer_reviews.text: Was filling them with sand and it broke apart in the first several minutes of having them. Stitching not sturdy. Says it holds 20-25lbs and didn't even get 15 lbs in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill and high quality. Slightly disappointed when our tent still lifted because the leg was still able to slide freely against the strap. We could get them tight enough. Had to tie a rope and feed between the tent and the top loop.
customer_reviews.author: Shane VanMatre

customer_reviews.title: Velcro problem
customer_reviews.text: I hope the seller reads this review! I would like one replacement bag sent to me please. Purchased this product because of its good reviews. Used these weight bags last weekend at the beach and they worked as advertised. One problem though...Each bag had two hook and loop Velcro fasteners. One of the weight bags I received only has one fastener that grips. The other fastener was sewn with two pieces of “loop” and not one piece of “hook” and one piece of “loop”. So, I’m happy with the bags overall but wish quality control had caught this defective bag before it was released for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in a Pinch!
customer_reviews.text: They are bulky once filled (to be expected), but they were exactly what I needed on a windy day to keep my tent from blowing away during the art festival! Would also be great for the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee T

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding umbrellas down
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty durable. I use them with my patio umbrellas. I live in New Mexico where we have wind just about everyday and my umbrellas kept falling down even with the slightest wind so I bought these here in hopes that it would work and yessss they work. I have 2 of them filled with rocks and I put it on my stand alone umbrella and the other 2 I also put rocks and I have it on my umbrella that goes with a table and they both stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amirah

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Canopy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after I purchased a pop-up canopy and was going on a multi-day camping trip in the national park. I wanted something to secure it in case it was windy or we had poor weather. These are well made and easy to fill (we used rocks). It kept the canopy nice and secure and I was not afraid of it blowing down.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Needed repairs out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Had to restitch the bottom of 3 out of the 4 bags. We needed them and did not have time to return them! SUPER FRUSTRATING!
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Opening is too small
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to be able to place a 2-ltr soda bottle filled with water or sand in each one of these, but the openings are too small. I do not want to just place loose sand or rocks in them as I fear it will attract insects and spiders. I have one of these on each leg of my gas grill shelter and still felt the need to chain the shelter to my grill to keep it from "lifting off" during some recent windy weather (30-40 mph gusts).
customer_reviews.author: JoanJett83

customer_reviews.title: Held it down
customer_reviews.text: Brought along for a social distancing trip to a beach in Texas. Quite windy to the point where people Didn’t take a chance putting up their canopies. This did exactly what it was intended to do. Will use secondarily as an anchor for inflatable bounce house as well. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Razor

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend. Return window only 30
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of the 4 broke open after the second time using them. Was hoping for higher quality. Would not recommend. Return window only 30 days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these weight bags exceed the expectation
customer_reviews.text: I don’t give 5 star if I am not satisfy even by 1% of product I ordered. I must say these weight bags exceed the expectation. We did beach camping last weekend, and I used these weight bags for my strait legs canopy. Most of the time its windy on beach and its very difficult to stabilize canopy. These begs worked as camp. Its super build quality with two straps, gave solid stability to canopy. It did not move an inch in windy gust. Usually I do lot or research before I buy any product. If you are looking for weight bags, save your time and order these bags.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for the wind to blow!
customer_reviews.text: These four canopy weights, attached to each of the four legs, will help keep the canopy on the ground in the the occurrence of high winds. They haven't yet been tested in really high and gusty winds, but so far in minor winds have kept the canopy firmly on the ground. Rather than fill them with sand, which has a tendency to clump in rain, I filled them with river pebbles. They appear to be sturdy, are easy to attach to the legs, and are easy to transport to the venue where the canopy is to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, functional, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy bag construction, doesn't leak sand as long as you get the closure secured well. I was able to get about 20 pounds of sand in each one and still have enough room to close it well at the top. My only issue has been that the carry strap on one of them tore off while I was carrying it - and after only 1 or 2 uses. However, that did not affect the bag's top closure, and the straps to hold it to the tent poles are intact, so not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on a windy day
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased these along with a tent and I ended up using them on the first day that I had the tent. I was at work so I didn't have many options for what I could put inside. I ended up putting a 5-pound brick used for lifeguarding protests and bottles that are used to chemically balance out a pool. I used them on the two legs that I was not able to tie down and I had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Must have for those pop up canopies
customer_reviews.text: Keeps canopy in place without staking, great for the windy beach where stakes don't work.. Helpful hint.. put the sand in plastic sandwich bags then put in these, clean up is much easier when it's time to go home. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made & Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for securing my new pop up shade canopy. As soon as we got to the beach we gave them to the kids to fill with sand. Was fun for them and one less thing for the adults to do. They also enjoyed emptying. Velcro straps make for easy on and off attachment to legs of the pop up Peace of mind that our pop up wouldn’t fly away if a breeze came up.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, durable SAND BAGS to add weight to patio furniture.
customer_reviews.text: A few years ago, we purchased a set to use with our commercial vendor canopy at Farmer's markets. They have been so durable, effective and easy to use for 3 years.... and now we purchased more to use under our patio furniture during storms and windy events. Our patio fronts to the northwest and we receive a lot of extreme wind on that side of the house. We've had lots of broken, overturned or damaged items over the years...so we got smart about it.
customer_reviews.author: S L R

customer_reviews.title: Not pool stair weights despite coming up first in search
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these because they were one of the first items to come up in a search for pool stair weights. Thought it strange since they were canopy weights but I assumed the company intentionally designed their key words that way. Unfortunately these cannot get wet, as the sand will then seep right out of the fabric. They also seem like they wouldn't be very useful for my canopy the way the straps are designed - but I'll give them a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect application!
customer_reviews.text: Very clean looking and does not take up space like a small bucket or large weights. Buy a tube of sand, fill the bags and store them in a 5gallon bucket. Easy to move that way and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mustradi

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Filled them with bags of play sand and attached one to each leg with the attached Velcro straps. Appear to be well made. Delivery was very fast. Picture was taken at night and so not very clear. I plan to buy another set and add one more to each leg as extra reinforcement. Tent came with tie down straps, so also attached each one of those to a metal tie down bracket that corkscrews into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, sturdy construction - Velcro closure perfect for sand
customer_reviews.text: Super heavy duty, sturdy construction. They have a loop at the top that we tied to our canopy tether. Velcro closure is perfect for sand. Zippers would jam.
customer_reviews.author: TedHTS

customer_reviews.title: Works well with ABC Cannopy
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these to use instead of the standard ones that come with the ABC Canopy. We ordered these to use on the beach. You can also used the bags that come with the canopy if you are worried about the wind. They have 2 sections to fill with sand. Each pocket would easily hold a 2 liter filled with sand or water to use as weights.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kielty

customer_reviews.title: Bags of Sand Are Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Who would have thought that these worked so well? Not I, I said as I loaded up the bags on a windy beach day for a classic pole tent. Instead of attaching to the leg of a pop up tent, I used these to tie ripcord to my tarp/pole tent and laying flat on the beach. The double cylinder design increases the surface area drag and kept the lines taught. Took ten minutes from start to finish to load the bags, hoist the poles and lay blankets underneath - much to the awe and wonder of the local crowd.
customer_reviews.author: GB44

customer_reviews.title: Just wish the velcro was a tad longer
customer_reviews.text: Very nice to have and fill with rocks or bottled sand to weigh chairs and canopies down.....just wish that the velcro strip was about an inch or 2 longer. That way you can lock it in around larger legs. Until then, I had to buy velcro and attach it to the already existing velcro strip. Nice and well sewn and sturdy though. A good buy otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Yabbadabbadoo

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: The straps that are used to secure the bags around the umbrella are NOT long enough. They WILL wrap around a regular umbrella pole. BUT they will NOT wrap around the wider umbrella s base pole holder. So, they end up kind of precariously perched higher up above the base connector and it looks kind of stupid. Also I ended up using two per pole to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: C J Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Torn Bag Upon Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Came with a torn bag. Arrrgh me maties, I'll be lookin' like a scurvy dog at the market with thar here sandbags... Seriously though, these bags are very expensive for some sandbag pouches. That being said, I expected them to be aesthetically pleasing and functional. Not so much with the duct tape I had to plaster on one. Oh, they're functional now though at least.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Put your sand into quart baggies first.
customer_reviews.text: I took other's advice, and put my sand into doubled quart size freezer bags, and then loaded them into the sleeve compartments. This seems to work well. The velcro keeping it closed seems wide and sturdy. I do wish that there was a supplemental strap that kept the 2 wings wrapped around the canopy pole, but I can add my own bungee cord.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: The fabric is not heavy duty and seems like it would tear after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is not heavy duty and seems like it would tear after a few uses. The seams are not heavy duty either. These bags would fall apart in very little time. Returned them. I am using Home Depot 33 cent sandbags and using a bungie cord to attach to the legs of my canopy instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Adams

customer_reviews.title: Neither wind or gusts will prevent these weight bags from performing their job.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that my new canopy would be carried away by the wind on the beach at the ocean. I had little to fear with these weight bags. I quickly filled them with a small shovel, they Velcro closed and around the legs. Not a budge. Now I just wish I could get back to the beach more often.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Spitler

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a week at the beach
customer_reviews.text: We bought two sets of four bags - doubled them up on each leg. We had no problems with the wind lifting our 6x6 sun tent. putting two bags on each leg made for a secure hold down. I saw other tents on the beach held down by "screw anchors". These seemed as secure and maybe a little easier to set up but I have no first hand experience with them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid for these, I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality. They are well made and worked well for my 10x10 pop-up canopy. They were large enough to hold the canopy down in the strong beach winds on the Outer Banks of North Carolina. They worked way better than any type of sand anchor I had tried before. I'd definitely recommend these to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pape

customer_reviews.title: Work well. Takes the liability out of your tent flying around and hurting someone.
customer_reviews.text: As described. FYI Pic them up with both hands and attach both loops. In other words use them as designed. If you grab only one strap with it full of rocks or sand, the straps will likely tear. That is your fault, not the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Pawleys Island

customer_reviews.title: These are worth their weight in.....sand
customer_reviews.text: If you own a pop-up tent and plan to use it on a beach you should buy these. Why would anyone want to carry around heavy, bulky weights when mother nature provided all the weight you need at your destination? These pack flat, are easy to fill and strap to the legs of the tent, and they're vinyl lined so they're easy to clean up afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Cyle Caplinger

customer_reviews.title: After 4 years of use, Velcro stops working
customer_reviews.text: I've used these weight bags for 4 years performance painting. I use them to weight down my art easel. In order to attach the weight bag, I hang it over the support using the provided Velcro strips. After 4 years of use the Velcro is starting to not function. Debating if I should buy this item again...
customer_reviews.author: Heilig Art

customer_reviews.title: Well made but could not stand up to moderate winds
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product to hold down a square screened awning on our rental home patio. We filled each bag with heavy rocks and wrapped around each corner brace. They seemed sturdy and well made. Nearly every time I used the awning, I noticed that the bags and the awning had shifted in moderate Kansas winds. I do not recommend this if you intend to permanently anchor such an awning, at least on the prairie.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Wiebe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I used these when we went camping and I used rocks inside to weigh them down....worked perfectly! Because of their washable/durable material, I just rinsed them out and folded them up. They pack flat so they can pretty much go in any bag, under your car seat, or behind the bench seat in your truck. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Margy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and dismantle on the beach, velcro helps make tents stable
customer_reviews.text: These were very easy to slide onto the tent canopy legs and quickly fill with sand. It held the tent securely and the sand did not leak or blow everywhere. I love that it has velcro to securely hold onto the tent legs and stand it up for extra stability. It held up in beach winds.
customer_reviews.author: H. Pham

customer_reviews.title: I must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product if you have your easy up or shade in something you can’t take down I got a swap meet or in the driveway concrete side of the house type of a deal you just fill it up with something heavy and it holds it down so the wind doesn’t take it away and destroy it
customer_reviews.author: jesse jay blair

customer_reviews.title: Solid tent
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these and was skeptical at first but so far so good! They seem to work perfect and preventing our tent from moving the slightest against the Texas’ Gulf of Mexico strong crazy winds!
customer_reviews.author: ale vineski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product great for the beach
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have. I bought these before our beach trip for our canopy and they do exactly what they are supposed to we didn’t have to a hot down on canopy all we did was have our kids fill the bags up and we attached them to the legs and that was it canopy not once budged.
customer_reviews.author: whisper acord

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We were well pleased with these sandbags, they were easy to fill and met ; exceeded our exceptions. Pleased enough that we will be ordering several more later this week ....We use these in our festival booth and we experienced a windy day and our booth remained sturdy....Good Job !!
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Levell

customer_reviews.title: The bags are well made and sturdy. Been using 'em all summer to hold down ...
customer_reviews.text: The bags are well made and sturdy. Been using 'em all summer to hold down a 10x10 canopy. Just don't overfill them with sand or the velcro won't hold tight and they will leak. (Not really the bag's fault but some thicker velcro strips would help - minor concern at best.)
customer_reviews.author: ClarksonFace

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: We have a pop-up we use at trade shows, and when it's outside and on concrete, the only way to keep it from flying off is to either use a cinder block, or better, we got these, fill them with sand, and wrap them around the bottom of the legs. That was easy!
customer_reviews.author: Regular Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Industrial Grade Canopy Weight Bags a bust
customer_reviews.text: Product stated would fit 50mm pole. Maybe when it is empty but not when you fill it with sand. Product information said the bag would hold 20 - 25 pounds of sand maybe 15. Not what I was expecting from this product.
customer_reviews.author: marcia

customer_reviews.title: Very effective!
customer_reviews.text: I use this set in combination with the 4 that's already included with my ANCCanopy tent, and the polls haven't moved an inch from the spots they were raised. After storms, high winds, hot sunny days, they kept to their locations, and no damages on any of them. I also have a roll of super strong wide Gorilla duct tape just in case I need any patching up, but it hasn't been used yet.
customer_reviews.author: Boomster

customer_reviews.title: one time use only
customer_reviews.text: Used these only one time and the bags already started ripping and leaking sand. I may be able to get one more use out of them but It's not worth having the sand leak out all over my van. You get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: alleykat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill and store.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought a pop-up canopy to use at the beach in FL. We realised that we needed some weights to keep it from blowing away. These bags are great. You can fill with sand or water while at the beach and then empty when done. Fabric seems quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping tents in place
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to provide stability for our canopy at the beach. Easy to fill and empty. Easily straps on to the base of the legs. Very pleased with the quality fabric and construction. They work great and we highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LR - Virginia Beach

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these weights! This was my second time ordering them. I use them on my backyard movie theater screen, my hammock so it doesn't blow over on windy days, I used them to weigh down a gazebo tent that recently put together. Versatile as to the weights you choose. Rocks, dirt, sand, etc
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: STEADY!
customer_reviews.text: They worked very well holding our canopy stable on the beach with winds of 10 to 11 MPH with occasional gusts to 15 MPH. Anything more than that, I'd want the larger volume bags. Very pleased with the quality of these and they worked well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not filled
customer_reviews.text: Came empty vs weighted which surprised me, but I probably should have read up on. For the price, I imagined they would be filled. We used them at the beach for our tent and they were very easy to fill with sand for the week and empty afterwards making them easier to travel with regarding weight and space. Should be interesting when we don’t have sand at the ballpark.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay C.

customer_reviews.title: Small, but effective sand bags
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use and they don't spill out the sand! It is a little tricky to fill them, but once filled they are very durable and easy to use. I bought a 50 lb bag of play sand it I could fit almost all of it between the 8 pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Trailxblazersx11

customer_reviews.title: Easy and secure
customer_reviews.text: Uses for a week down the shore and they were great. Sometines used 2, sometimes 4. I dont think it ever got really windy, but for breezes and general beach weather it was great. Kids helped fill them up, quick velcro and you're done.
customer_reviews.author: cw9113

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a breeze but not a windy day
customer_reviews.text: At first, i thought these were great. They worked well for the first few hours on the beach. Then the wind started to pick up and I could see the tent lift and move. My uncle’s tent next to us did even budge. I’m returning these and getting ones like his. These are fine for a slight breeze not a windy day.
customer_reviews.author: S Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Get these instead of the large base
customer_reviews.text: What I like about these bags, is that they allow you to easily move the umbrella around, whereas the large bases don't. Just fill these up with medium-sized river rocks, and they will provide more than enough support.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The package looked new but one bag clearly had a shoe print on it so it had been stepped on but other than that it was fine. I filled the bags with large river rocks ...
customer_reviews.text: They arrived quickly. The package looked new but one bag clearly had a shoe print on it so it had been stepped on but other than that it was fine. I filled the bags with large river rocks from my yard. They attach well and easy with the velcro. It was very simple and quick. I am using them on a 10x10 canopy and it has held up well. I've only had them 3 days but the last 2 days have been very windy and the canopy has not moved. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Camp

customer_reviews.title: It's not just for canopies
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to weigh down some light weight patio chairs that tend to take flight when I have strong wind gusts in my yard. Two per chair seems to do the trick, although time will tell. The sandbags I used previously (which eventually disintegrated) held more sand than these do. But I'm very satisfied at this point with these. The velcro ties actually attach well to the base of this particular type of chair. The fabric seems quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Takes just under 1.0 cubic feet to fill all 4 bags. Buy 2 bags of .05 cubic feet sand bags and you will be spot on. (if you are buying bags of sand)
customer_reviews.author: derek

customer_reviews.title: Beach necessity
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use with our beach canopy. So convenient. Easy to stow away and the extra stability is gives to our beach canopy is amazing. Even on a windy beach day our canopy doesn’t budge with these easy to use sandbags.
customer_reviews.author: crooney

customer_reviews.title: One bag had a hole in it.....
customer_reviews.text: I was happy receiving these bags. But after filling them up. I got to the last bag of the four and the sand went right through one side of the bag and filled up correctly on the other. So disappointed.....
customer_reviews.author: Khara

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT BUT NO ATTENTION TO DETAIL
customer_reviews.text: Great product but product inspection out the window--at least with the one I got. One of the bag-pair I received did not have the velcro sewn on to the strap so it is kind of difficult to strap it up to the canopy pole! Otherwise, it looks durable and, so far, doing its job. The patio canopy frame is still with us!
customer_reviews.author: JimmyR

customer_reviews.title: Weights don’t come with this
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that it didn’t come with weights, I have to now find weights that fit! Would have been a better buy if I didn’t now have to spend money and time finding weights. Can’t use till I get weights.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Works in high wind off a ridge in North West Ontario
customer_reviews.text: We have very high winds on our property due to Lake Superior and a ridge beside us. We put 2 liter bottles filled with water in side these and they worked great! There is no ridge vent on our canopy so we really need these.
customer_reviews.author: SoBelleMaggie

customer_reviews.title: Great Weights for Patio Canopy
customer_reviews.text: I honestly would have rated this 5 stars if the straps were made a tad bit longer perhaps an extra 3 inches so they can wrap completely around the canopy legs. I had to tug quite a bit to get them to snap together. If you have wide canopy legs - you may want to consider this before purchasing. Overall, I love the various color options as the grey color matched my canopy exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Amadi

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your canopy
customer_reviews.text: They work great! They hug the legs for the canopy just perfectly. It is an inexpensive solution for stabilizing the canopy, especially if you don't have a place to stake it down (like when you are in a parking lot, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: KitKat1983

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to use to weight a canopy (10×10) at an event festival. I filled them with sand. Storms with heavy wind blew in and these weights held the canopy with no problem. I was impressed. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: austin vick
